title: Founding Fathers Quiz
description: How well do you remember America's Founding Fathers and their contributions?

questions.question: Who is known as the 'Father of the Constitution'?
questions.explanation: James Madison is called the 'Father of the Constitution' for his pivotal role in drafting and promoting the US Constitution and the Bill of Rights.

questions.question: Which Founding Father was known for his experiments with electricity?
questions.explanation: Benjamin Franklin conducted his famous kite experiment in 1752, proving that lightning was electrical in nature.

questions.question: Who was the first Secretary of the Treasury?
questions.explanation: Alexander Hamilton served as the first Secretary of the Treasury from 1789 to 1795, establishing the nation's financial system.

questions.question: Which Founding Father became the second President of the United States?
questions.explanation: John Adams served as the second President from 1797 to 1801, after serving as George Washington's Vice President.

questions.question: Who wrote 'Common Sense,' the pamphlet that inspired American independence?
questions.explanation: Thomas Paine published 'Common Sense' in January 1776, arguing powerfully for American independence from Britain.

questions.question: Which Founding Father served as the first Chief Justice of the Supreme Court?
questions.explanation: John Jay was appointed by George Washington as the first Chief Justice of the United States in 1789, serving until 1795.

questions.question: Who gave the famous 'Give me liberty, or give me death!' speech?
questions.explanation: Patrick Henry delivered this famous speech on March 23, 1775, urging Virginia to join the American Revolution.

questions.question: Which Founding Father's signature is the largest on the Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation: John Hancock, as President of the Continental Congress, signed first and largest, reportedly saying he wanted King George to be able to read it without his spectacles.

questions.question: Which Founding Father negotiated the Louisiana Purchase?
questions.explanation: President Thomas Jefferson negotiated the Louisiana Purchase from France in 1803, doubling the size of the United States.

questions.question: Who was Commander-in-Chief of the Continental Army during the Revolutionary War?
questions.explanation: George Washington was appointed Commander-in-Chief of the Continental Army in 1775 and led the colonies to victory in the Revolutionary War.

questions.question: Which Founding Father was killed in a duel with Aaron Burr?
questions.explanation: Alexander Hamilton was fatally shot by Vice President Aaron Burr in a duel on July 11, 1804, in Weehawken, New Jersey.

questions.question: Who was the primary author of the Federalist Papers along with Hamilton and Jay?
questions.explanation: James Madison, along with Alexander Hamilton and John Jay, wrote the Federalist Papers to promote ratification of the Constitution.

questions.question: Which Founding Father established the University of Virginia?
questions.explanation: Thomas Jefferson founded the University of Virginia in 1819 and personally designed its original buildings and curriculum.

questions.question: Which two Founding Fathers both died on July 4, 1826, the 50th anniversary of independence?
questions.explanation: Both Thomas Jefferson and John Adams died on July 4, 1826, exactly 50 years after the Declaration of Independence was adopted.

questions.question: Which Founding Father served as the American ambassador to France during the Revolution?
questions.explanation: Benjamin Franklin served as the American ambassador to France from 1778 to 1785, securing crucial French support for the American Revolution.
